title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hartford
Interview Descriptions:
Question: What would you do if there is a crisis?
Question: How do you avoid favoritism if a friend of yours is one of your residents?
Question: What is your proudest achievement?
Question: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?
Interview Questions:
Question: How do you avoid favoritism if a friend of yours is one of your residents?
Question: What is your proudest achievement?
Question: Why do you think you are a good fit for this position?

title: Couneslor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hartford
Interview Descriptions: Very detailed and there was a panel of 4 people. The one negative thing about the interview was they didn't reach out until I sent a second follow-up. Overall, I thought the interview was a great experience considering it was my first one.
Interview Questions: Is technology a strong suit of yours?

title: Digital Marketing Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hartford
Interview Descriptions: Process is normal, two interviews then you go from there, it was a great time working there a lot of opportunity to learn marketing skills and for growth. Great opportunity

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hartford
Interview Descriptions: 1:1 Interview with supervisor. One should be ready with their career interests and professional goals and well versed in their basics to attend the interview. There will questions related to your core major subjects.

title: Business Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hartford in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: Email with HR and directly sent to the Department . I was expecting a one on one interview and instead was boraged with questions from 6 people. The majority  of those present didn't really contribute much to the interview.
Interview Questions: If I was comfortable with communicating via email rather than picking up the phone.

title: Associate Director - Institutional Advancement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hartford in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Hiring manager directly scheduled and participated in an initial phone screen. After a positive conversation we scheduled an in-person meeting a few weeks later with a committee of potential colleagues, the VP of the department, and one-on-one with the hiring manager, followed by filling out background check paperwork at HR. These interviews, while positive, made it clear that I wouldn't be the right fit for the job.  But, the hiring manager did not respond to my follow-up emails, and Human Resources did not send a formal "we've moved on" email until ~4 months after. I'd like to think that HR dragged their feet and that the lack of response from the department itself was just to not step on toes in the bureaucratic higher-ed environment. In any event, the latency between the last contact I had with them and any update regarding my status was incredibly unprofessional.
Interview Questions: What were some of the metrics you used in communications?

title: Assistant Professor - Visiting Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Hartford (West Hartford, CT) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in CV and cover letter with reference contact information
Had a Skype interview
Had a series of face to face interviews (some in office, some at restaurants) and conducted a teaching demo
Interview Questions: What novel would you select to require all students read that speaks to all ethnic, racial, and gender diversities?

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hartford (West Hartford, CT)
Interview Descriptions: They took me out to lunch and it was a nice conversation in a low-pressure atmosphere. I did a lot of research on the Univeristy and Department so I had many questions. It was a relaxing experience.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Hartford
Interview Descriptions: It was overall a good exeriance

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Hartford (West Hartford, CT) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews.  First over the phone and the second in person.  The first interview consisted of questions designed to identify qualified candidates for an in person interview focusing on experience to determine how prepared a candidate was for a further interview.  The second interview tconsisted of a series of meetings with faculty and staff.
Interview Questions: Describe your experience and how that relates to the position you applied for?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Hartford (West Hartford, CT) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Typical interview process of meeting with faculty, the search committee, the Dean, and in my case, the Provost. I also had to give a research talk and teach an undergraduate class.
Interview Questions: Why I want to join the University of Harford?

title: Vocal Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Hartford (Hartford, CT) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very professionally handled.  The interviewer had extensive knowledge of the schools programs and abilitiies of the students.  I was made to feel comfortable in the knowledge that my personal expertise was both accepted and appreciated. The facilities were freely shown and were of a high quality for vocal education.
